intro: Loeflingia hispanica var. transiens, commonly known as the Spanish dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
